column6: A survey of the role of human service technologists, their professional and ethical responsibilities, employment possibilities and avenues for professional advancement.
The structure and function of groups, focusing on problem solving and communication in human service agencies.
A survey of providers at the federal, regional, state and local levels, including services provided and regulations of private and public agencies.
The dynamics of helping relationship in human services agencies. Skill development in listening and provision of assistance to clients is emphasized.
An introduction to the evaluation of client needs and assessment of client condition.

column2: CLIENT ADVOCACY AND CASE MANAGEMENT IN HUMAN SERVICE ORGANIZATIONS
column6: Assessment of case management strategies with an emphasis on the role of the client advocate in the human service setting.

column2: INTERNSHIP IN HUMAN SERVICES TECHNOLOGY I
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Supervised field experience in a human service agency (minimum of 16 hours per week) . Joint university-agency supervision.

column2: INTERNSHIP IN HUMAN SERVICES TECHNOLOGY II
column6: (Repeatable for credit) Continued supervised field experience in a human services agency (minimum 16 hours per week) . Joint university-agency supervision.
